exercise.playOnPiano: Play the notes on the piano below...

home.heroSubtitle: From reading notes to understanding complex harmonies — learn at your own pace with interactive exercises and instant feedback.
home.categoriesSubtitle: Choose a category to start practicing. Each exercise generates unlimited questions to help you master the skill.
home.progressionsSubtitle: Practice common chord progressions from classical and jazz music. Play along with your MIDI keyboard or on-screen piano.
home.footerText: © 2024 Harmony Tutor. Learn music theory the interactive way.

categories.staffReadingDesc: Learn to read notes on the musical staff quickly and accurately.
categories.intervalsDesc: Master musical intervals — the building blocks of harmony and melody.
categories.scalesDesc: Understand scales, keys, and how notes function within a tonal context.

staffNoteIdentification.title: Staff Note Identification
staffNoteIdentification.description: Identify single notes on the musical staff. A great starting point for reading music.

staffNoteClefSwitching.title: Note ID: Treble vs Bass
staffNoteClefSwitching.description: Same as above but the clef randomly switches. Train to adapt quickly!

accidentalReading.title: Accidental Reading
accidentalReading.description: A note with ♯/♭ appears — identify the sounding note (e.g., "F#", "Bb").

ledgerLines.title: Ledger Lines Trainer
ledgerLines.description: Notes only above/below the staff — identify quickly for improved fluency.
ledgerLines.hint: Notes on ledger lines extend above or below the staff

keySignatureIdentification.title: Key Signature Identification
keySignatureIdentification.description: Show a key signature → choose the key (Major keys, then add relative minor at harder levels).

keySignatureNotes.title: Key Signature: Affected Notes
keySignatureNotes.description: Given a key signature, identify which notes are sharp or flat.
keySignatureNotes.promptSharp: In {{key}} major, which notes are sharp?
keySignatureNotes.promptFlat: In {{key}} major, which notes are flat?
keySignatureNotes.hintSharp: Sharps follow the order: F, C, G, D, A, E, B
keySignatureNotes.hintFlat: Flats follow the order: B, E, A, D, G, C, F

intervalHarmonic.title: Interval ID (Harmonic)
intervalHarmonic.description: Two notes stacked (played together) → pick the interval (m3, M3, P5…).
intervalHarmonic.hint: Count the distance between the two notes (including both notes)

intervalMelodic.title: Interval ID (Melodic)
intervalMelodic.description: Two consecutive notes on the staff → pick the interval.
intervalMelodic.hint: This is the distance between two consecutive notes

intervalConstructionUp.title: Interval Construction (Up)
intervalConstructionUp.description: Given a starting note and target interval ("Build a P5 up") → select the second note.

intervalConstructionDown.title: Interval Construction (Down)
intervalConstructionDown.description: Same as above, but build the interval downward.

intervalQualityDrill.title: Interval Quality Drill
intervalQualityDrill.description: Make a 3rd that is minor, or a 5th that is diminished — same number, different quality.

scaleIdentification.title: Scale Identification
scaleIdentification.description: Show a scale (notes on staff) → choose Major or Natural Minor (+ tonic on harder mode).
scaleIdentification.promptBasic: Is this scale Major or Minor?
scaleIdentification.hintMajor: Major scales have a bright, happy sound
scaleIdentification.hintMinor: Minor scales have a dark, sad sound

scaleIdentificationAdvanced.title: Scale Identification (Advanced)
scaleIdentificationAdvanced.description: Identify both the type and root note of the scale.

scaleConstruction.title: Scale Construction
scaleConstruction.description: Build a scale: "Build G major" → select the correct sequence of notes.

degreeIdentification.title: Scale Degree Identification
degreeIdentification.description: Given a key (e.g., "D major") + one note → choose its scale degree (1–7, or "non-diatonic").
degreeIdentification.prompt: In {{key}} major, what scale degree is this note?

triads.title: Building Triads
triads.description: Learn to build major and minor triads in root position.
triads.hintMajor: A Major triad consists of a root, a major third, and a perfect fifth.
triads.hintMinor: A Minor triad consists of a root, a minor third, and a perfect fifth.

seventhChords.title: Building 7th Chords
seventhChords.description: Learn to build the most common seventh chords in root position.

susChords.title: Building Sus Chords
susChords.description: Build suspended chords (sus2 and sus4) in different keys.

alteredTriads.title: Building Diminished / Augmented Triads
alteredTriads.description: Build diminished (dim) and augmented (aug) triads in different keys.

seqA.title: Sequence A (I-IV-V-I)
seqA.description: The most fundamental cadence in Western music.

seqB.title: Sequence B (I-V⁶₅-I)
seqB.description: Using the dominant seventh in first inversion.

jazzRhythmBridge.title: Jazz: Rhythm Changes Bridge
jazzRhythmBridge.description: The bridge section of Rhythm Changes.

chordHints.maj7: Major 7 chord: root + major 3rd + perfect 5th + major 7th.
chordHints.m7: Minor 7 chord: root + minor 3rd + perfect 5th + minor 7th.
chordHints.dom7: Dominant 7 chord: root + major 3rd + perfect 5th + minor 7th.
chordHints.sus2: Sus2 replaces the 3rd with the 2nd: root + 2nd + 5th.
chordHints.sus4: Sus4 replaces the 3rd with the 4th: root + 4th + 5th.
